sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
Consider the following matrix A= 

$$\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 &8 & 9 \end{pmatrix}$$

Determine the rank of matrix A using elementary row operations.
message_2:
To determine the rank of matrix A, we will perform elementary row operations to get the matrix into its row-echelon form.

Matrix A:

$$\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 &8 & 9 \end{pmatrix}$$

Step 1: Subtract 4 times the first row from the second row:

$$\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & -3 & -6 \\ 7 &8 & 9 \end{pmatrix}$$

Step 2: Subtract 7 times the first row from the third row:

$$\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & -3 & -6 \\ 0 & -6 & -12 \end{pmatrix}$$

Step 3: Divide the second row by -3:

$$\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 1 & 2 \\ 0 & -6 & -12 \end{pmatrix}$$

Step 4: Add 6 times the second row to the third row:

$$\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{pmatrix}$$

Now the matrix is in row-echelon form. We can see that there are two non-zero rows, so the rank of matrix A is 2.
